summary: This is an email exchange between U.S. Attorney's Office personnel on June 13-14, 2019, discussing a draft indictment against Jeffrey Epstein. The sender expresses concerns that the draft is too sparse and needs to be 'bulked up' to instill public confidence and provide more material for a press conference, while balancing victim protection.

persons.name: Geoff
persons.context: Mentioned as the person who would need more material to work with at a press conference regarding the Epstein indictment.

events.title: Draft Indictment Prepared
events.description: A draft indictment against Jeffrey Epstein is prepared and sent for review by the U.S. Attorney's Office.

events.title: Review of Draft Indictment
events.description: Email feedback is provided on the draft Epstein indictment, suggesting it needs to be more substantial to instill public confidence and support a press conference.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: A draft indictment against Jeffrey Epstein was under review by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York in June 2019.
Internal concerns were raised that the draft indictment was 'too sparse' and needed to be 'bulked up' to instill public confidence in the case.
The need to balance victim protection, especially for anonymous victims, with providing sufficient detail for public messaging and a press conference was explicitly discussed.
The correspondence indicates strategic planning for a press conference related to the Epstein indictment.
